result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Judgment for restitution; Joint and Several w/14CF52 and 14CF82

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served concurrent with any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bond in 13-CM-1300 (previously dismissed and read-in) shall be applied to outstanding financials in 14-CF-78.  
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate to be determined by DOC and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall have no contact with Marybeth Bria or her residence or family, Michael Jankowski, Sara Bria, Michael Ludwig, Lisa Kaczmarek or their residences and the Windgate Creek BP Gas Station.  
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or dealers.
Defendant shall have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are used, packaged or distributed.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall advise all treating doctors of his drug abuse history.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed and reading waived.  Resolution reached; State agrees not to charge Trenton Referral #14167.  PSI recommended with both sides free to argue; State agrees to cap confinement recommendation at 3-4 years; no cap on ES but defense free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read in 13CM1300, 13CM1336 and 14CM346 along with plea to 14CF78 and 14CF104 and Court so orders.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1.
